intro: Isotrema liukiuense, commonly known as the Ryukyu isotrema, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
